title: JSON schema for OctoberCMS form fields

label.description: a name when displaying the form field to the user

type.description: defines how this field should be rendered

span.description: aligns the form field to one side. Options: auto, left, right, row, full. Default: full.

spanClass.description: used with the span row property to display the form as a Bootstrap grid, for example, spanClass: col-4

size.description: specifies a field size for fields that use it, for example, the textarea field

placeholder.description: if the field supports a placeholder value

comment.description: places a descriptive comment below the field

commentAbove.description: places a comment above the field

commentHtml.description: allow HTML markup inside the comment

default.description: specifies the default value for the field

defaultFrom.description: takes the default value from the value of another field

tab.description: assigns the field to a tab

cssClass.description: assigns a CSS class to the field container

autoFocus.description: flags the field to be focused when the form loads. Default: false

readOnly.description: prevents the field from being modified

disabled.description: prevents the field from being modified and excludes it from the saved data

hidden.description: hides the field from the view and excludes it from the saved data

stretch.description: specifies if this field stretches to fit the parent height

context.description: specifies what context should be used when displaying the field. Context can also be passed by using an @ symbol in the field name, for example, name@update.

dependsOn.description: an array of other field names this field depends on, when the other fields are modified, this field will update

changeHandler.description: the name of an AJAX handler to call when the field value is changed, optional

trigger.description: specify conditions for this field using trigger events

action.description: defines the action applied to this field when the condition is met

field.description: defines the other field name that will trigger the action. Normally the field name refers to a field in the same level form. For example, if this field is in a repeater widget, only fields in that same repeater widget will be checked. However, if the field name is preceded by a caret symbol ^ like: ^parent_field, it will refer to a repeater widget or form one level higher than the field itself. Additionally, if more than one caret ^ is used, it will refer that many levels higher: ^^grand_parent_field, ^^^grand_grand_parent_field, etc.

condition.description: determines the condition the specified field should satisfy for the condition to be considered "true". Supported values: checked, unchecked, value[somevalue]

preset.description: allows the field value to be initially set by the value of another field, converted using the input preset converter

field.description: defines the other field name to source the value from

prefixInput.description: optional, prefixes the converted value with the value found in the supplied input element using a CSS selector

oneOf.description: value can be a string that refers to the field only, the type option will then default to slug

required.description: places a red asterisk next to the field label to indicate it is required (make sure to setup validation on the model as this is not enforced by the form controller)

attributes.description: specify custom HTML attributes to add to the form field element

containerAttributes.description: specify custom HTML attributes to add to the form field container

permissions.description: the permissions that the current backend user must have in order for the field to be used. Supports either a string for a single permission or an array of permissions of which only one is needed to grant access.

order.description: a numerical weight when determining the display order, default value increments at 100 points per field

anyOf.description: uses a specific method declared in the model's class

emptyOption.description: define an empty option that can be reselected

placeholder.description: define a "one-way" empty option that cannot be reselected

showSearch.description: by default the dropdown has a searching feature, allowing quick selection of a value. This can be disabled by setting this option to false

anyOf.description: uses a specific method declared in the model's class

showGutter.description: shows a gutter with line numbers

wrapWords.description: breaks long lines on to a new line

adding.description: allow records to be added to the data table

btnAddRowLabel.description: defines a custom label for the "Add Row Above" button

btnAddRowBelowLabel.description: defines a custom label for the "Add Row Below" button

btnDeleteRowLabel.description: defines a custom label for the "Delete Row" button

columns.description: an array representing the column configuration of the data table

deleting.description: allow records to be deleted from the data table

dynamicHeight.description: if true, the data table's height will extend or shrink depending on the records added, up to the maximum size defined by the height configuration value

fieldName.description: defines a custom field name to use in the POST data sent from the data table. Leave blank to use the default field alias

height.description: the data table's height, in pixels. If set to false, the data table will stretch to fit the field container

keyFrom.description: the data attribute to use for keying each record. This should usually be set to id

postbackHandlerName.description: defines a custom post-back handler to use when saving the data from the data table

recordsPerPage.description: the number of records to show per page. If set to false, the pagination will be disabled

searching.description: allow records to be searched via a search box

toolbar.description: an array representing the toolbar configuration of the data table

mode.description: the expected result, either date, datetime or time

format.description: provide an explicit date display format

minDate.description: the minimum/earliest date that can be selected

maxDate.description: the maximum/latest date that can be selected

yearRange.description: number of years to show either side, or an array of upper/lower range, example [1900,2015]. Default: 10

disableDays.description: days that cannot be selected, can be a number to represent Sunday (0) to Saturday (6), or a specific date (2024-10-01)

firstDay.description: the first day of the week. Default: 0 (Sunday)

twelveHour.description: display a 12-hour clock for selecting time. Default: false

hoursOnly.description: allows for selecting hours only while selecting time. Default: false

showWeekNumber.description: show week numbers at head of row. Default: false

useTimezone.description: convert the date and time from the backend specified timezone preference

mode.description: the expected file type, either file or image

fileTypes.description: file extensions that are accepted by the uploader, optional. Eg: zip,txt

mimeTypes.description: MIME types that are accepted by the uploader, either as file extension or fully qualified name, optional. Eg: bin,txt

maxFilesize.description: file size in Mb that are accepted by the uploader, optional. Default: from "upload_max_filesize" param value

maxFiles.description: maximum number of files allowed to be uploaded

useCaption.description: allows a title and description to be set for the file. Default: true

thumbOptions.description: additional resize options for generating the thumbnail, or pass false to disable thumb generation

deferredBinding.description: use deferred binding when uploading a file, when available. Disable this to attach the file immediately on upload instead of when saving. Default: true

thumbOptions.description: options to pass to the thumbnail generating method for the file

mode.description: specify how the image should be resized

interlace.description: specify if the generated image should be interlaced

prompt.description: text to display for the upload button

mode.description: the expected view mode, either tab or split
the expected file type, either file or image

prompt.description: text to display when there is no item selected. The %s character represents the media manager icon

imageWidth.description: text to display when there is no item selected. The %s character represents the media manager icon

usePanelStyles.description: defines if a panel like look is applied or not

list.description: configuration array or reference to a list column definition file, see list columns

keyFrom.description: the name of column to use in the relation used for key

nameFrom.description: the column name to use in the relation used for displaying the name

descriptionFrom.description: the column name to use in the relation used for displaying a description

title.description: text to display in the title section of the popup

prompt.description: text to display when there is no record selected. The %s character represents the search icon

recordsPerPage.description: records to display per page, use 0 for no pages

conditions.description: specifies a raw where query statement to apply to the list model query

scope.description: specifies a query scope method defined in the related form model to apply to the list query always. The first argument will contain the model that the widget will be attaching its value to, i.e. the parent model.

searchMode.description: defines the search strategy to either contain all words, any word or exact phrase. Supported options: all, any, exact

searchScope.description: specifies a query scope method defined in the related form model to apply to the search query, the first argument will contain the search term

useRelation.description: Flag for using the name of the field as a relation name to interact with directly on the parent model. Disable to return just the selected model's ID

modelClass.description: Class of the model to use for listing records when useRelation = false

nameFrom.description: a model attribute name used for displaying the relation label

select.description: a custom SQL select statement to use for the name

order.description: an order clause to sort options by. Example: name desc

emptyOption.description: text to display when there is no available selections

scope.description: specifies a query scope method defined in the related form model to apply to the list query always

prompt.description: text to display for the create button

titleFrom.description: name of field within items to use as the title for the collapsed item

minItems.description: minimum items required. Pre-displays those items when not using groups. For example if you set 'minItems: 1' the first row will be displayed and not hidden.

maxItems.description: maximum number of items to allow within the repeater

groups.description: references a group of form fields placing the repeater in group mode. An inline definition can also be used.

description.description: a brief description of the group

icon.description: defines an icon for the group, optional

toolbarButtons.description: which buttons to show on the editor toolbar. "|" will insert a vertical separator line in the toolbar and "-" a horizontal one.
toolbarButtons.default: fullscreen, bold, italic, underline, strikeThrough, subscript, superscript, fontFamily, fontSize, |, color, emoticons, inlineStyle, paragraphStyle, |, paragraphFormat, align, formatOL, formatUL, outdent, indent, quote, insertHR, -, insertLink, insertImage, insertVideo, insertAudio, insertFile, insertTable, undo, redo, clearFormatting, selectAll, html

mode.description: controls how the value is returned, either string, array or relation

separator.description: separate tags with the specified character, either comma or space

customTags.description: allows custom tags to be entered manually by the user

options.description: specifies a method or array for predefined options. Set to true to use model get*Field*Options method. Optional

useKey.description: use the key instead of value for saving and reading data

nameFrom.description: if relation mode is used, a model attribute name for displaying the tag name

keyFrom.description: the name of column to use in the relation used for key

nameFrom.description: the column name to use in the relation used for displaying the name

descriptionFrom.description: the column name to use in the relation used for displaying a description

mode.description: display mode for the sensitive field

allowCopy.description: allow copying of the sensitive value. Default: true

allowGenerate.description: allow generating a new value. Default: false

format.description: provides a display format. Supported values: long, short, null

anyOf.description: uses a specific method declared in the model's class

stretch.description: specifies if this tab stretches to fit the parent height

defaultTab.description: the default tab to assign fields to. Default: Misc

activeTab.description: selected tab when the form first loads, name or index. Default: 1

icons.description: assign icons to tabs using tab names as the key

lazy.description: array of tabs to be loaded dynamically when clicked. Useful for tabs that contain large amounts of content

identifiers.description: array of custom HTML identifiers for targeting the tab. Useful for showing and hiding tabs using JavaScript

linkable.description: determines if the tabs can be linked using URL fragments. Default: true

cssClass.description: assigns a CSS class to the tab container

paneCssClass.description: assigns a CSS class to an individual tab pane. Value is an array, key is tab index or label, value is the CSS class. It can also be specified as a string, in which case the value will be applied to all tabs.

.+.description: key is tab index or label, value is the CSS class

type.description: defines how this field should be rendered

float.description: Validates the data as a float. An optional boolean allowNegative attribute can be provided, allowing for negative float numbers

integer.description: Validates the data as an integer. An optional boolean allowNegative attribute can be provided, allowing for negative integers.

length.description: Validates the data to be of a certain length. An integer min and max attribute must be provided, representing the minimum and maximum number of characters that must be entered.

regex.description: Validates the data against a regular expression. A string pattern attribute must be provided, defining the regular expression to test the data against.

required.description: Validates that the data must be entered before saving.

options.description: specifies the AJAX handler that will return the available options, as an array. The array key is used as the value of the option, and the array value is used as the option label.
